    • Method Detail

      • shipCarton

        java.lang.String shipCarton(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext env,
                            java.lang.String s)
                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The shipCarton method of YCSshipCartonUserExit user exit is called by the addContainerToManifest API before manifesting a carton using carrier server. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit method for modifying the input XML. Input of this method is same as input XML prepared by Delivery and sent to YCS. Output of this method is used as input for executing the rest of shipCarton method. New attributes can be added to the output. Output XML is also expected to be similar to input XML. However, user is free to modify it to which ever structure he wants to and use YCS_PLD_Detail to map it to appropriate Carrier server specific XML.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API.


        NOTE: This user exit can be used to override Connection Parameters for Pierbridge Adaptor.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        s - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API on YCS. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • shipCartonContinue

        boolean shipCartonContinue(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext env,
                           java.lang.String s)
                    throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The shipCartonContinue method of YCSshipCartonUserExit user exit is called by the addContainerToManifest API before manifesting a carton using carrier server. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit for deciding whether the rest of shipCarton YCS method that calls appropriate carrier servers (FEDX/AIRB/UPS) should be executed or not. Input XML of this API is the output returned by shipCarton method of this user exit.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        s - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        boolean. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.


      • shipCartonOutXML

        java.lang.String shipCartonOutXML(com.yantra.shared.ycp.YFSContext env,
                                  java.lang.String s)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The shipCartonOutXML method of YCSshipCartonUserExit user exit is called by the addContainerToManifest API before manifesting a carton using carrier server. If you are extending the system you can use this user exit to manipulate data obtained from other systems and provide a standard input XML. If rest of the shipCarton YCS method should not be executed (shipCartonContinue returns false), then this method is used to return an output that would contain the Tracking#, Freight Charges etc. Input XML of this API is the output returned by shipCarton method of this user exit. And output XML should be similar to output returned by YCS back to Delivery.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This method is called conditionally (shipContinueCarton returns false).

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API.


        NOTE: This user exit can be used to override Connection Parameters for Pierbridge Adaptor.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to raise errors and access environment information.
        s - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document containing input XML data as required by the addContainerToManifest API on YCS. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
